intro: Cissampelos longipes, commonly known as the long-stemmed moonvine, is a climbing perennial vine native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by distinctive, elongated fruit pods. Its botanical features include opposite leaf arrangement and the presence of a milky sap. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
